info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:13PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Hamilton, Fulton, northwestern Schoharie and Montgomery Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Stratford to near Ames. Movement was east-northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Johnstown, Canajoharie, Fonda, Fort Plain, St. Johnsville, Ephratah, Mayfield, Stratford, Sharon Springs, Ames, Caroga Lake, Tribes Hill, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Glen, Oppenheim, Sharon, Berkshire, Charleston and Fultonville. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 28 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern and east central New York.
